text: this year's note release was interesting
to say the least for a number of
different reasons so it's not only
because there are now two notes as
opposed to just one but also because
this release has name near squashed the
distinction between the note and s line
of phones now don't get me wrong there
are still differences between the two
lines of course and there's no question
that the note 10 plus is the best phone
that Samsung has to offer the real
question is by how much
now I'll spare you the full on Note 10
plus vs s 10 + comparison we'll leave
that for a different video but during my
time with the note 10 plus as my main
phone I kind of found it difficult now
more than ever to get the thought of the
two devices being so incredibly similar
out of my head but when I finally did
and I was immersed into what this phone
has to offer I came to some unsurprising
conclusions this is the best of the best
from Samsung it's a great great phone
and it's a candidate for phone of the
year but again it's one of the most if
not the most interesting note release
we've seen and here's why besides what
I've already mentioned this year's Note
is interesting because from the very
beginning of the note has been the Swiss
Army knife of phones the phone that had
basically anything and everything
Samsung could possibly stuff into it
that's still the case however a step
back has been taken because this time
around
Samsung got rid of the headphone jack I
get it all Wireless everything is the
future and I barely ever use wired audio
accessories myself but it's funny how
Samsung just got finished talking about
how the S 10 kept the headphone jack not
too long ago it's always nice having
that option I just wish they could have
waited until next year at least oh well
Samsung also decided to get rid of the
power button on the right hand side of
the phone and they merged it with the
bixby button on the left again very
interesting but I won't say that it was
a bad choice and I got used to it pretty
quickly it totally beats the S 10 pluses
high placement that's for sure
I will say that taking screenshots with
my left hand can be a bit finicky you
kind of have to fat-finger it it's not
the end of the world though what is the
end of the world is this stupid giant
hole punch cutout at the top of the
display what in the world is this it
totally gets in the way of literally
everything I look at and I just can't
stop staring at it it is so ugly and I
utterly despise it yeah I'm totally
kidding
here's the thing there are a lot of
people who would actually agree with
that statement seriously for me though
it's a no big deal especially after
having used phones with the biggest of
notches phones with pill-shaped cutouts
this is hardly something to worry about
and I love how the community continues
to embrace it and comes up with some
clever wallpapers to just have fun with
it
all in all hardware is pretty much what
you'd expect from the top-tier Samsung
device it's super sturdy very premium
great feeling materials has got a
refined modern look the whole nine
complete with a smudge dub glass back
shout out to this video sponsored e
brand for the skins they really helped
out a lot you can check out this one and
many others using the link below in
everyday use the note 10 plus is pretty
much what I or anyone would expect
really it's familiar territory it's got
a big bright and gorgeous immersive
super colorful and crisp display it's
pure eye candy as usual and it's
obviously a larger phone a two-hander
for most it's got loud solid sounding
speakers the haptics are vastly improved
they feel almost iPhone like almost I
said almost he's got all the many
software features that come with one UI
and of course we've got the s-pen
something I did want to mention is after
coming over from the oneplus 7 pro I saw
just how much I've been spoiled by its
screens and ninety Hertz refresh rate
and boy do I miss that there's nothing
wrong with 60 Hertz at all and my eyes
have finally readjusted but man once
you've seen and used a panel with 90
Hertz or higher it's really hard to go
back to anything lower it's crazy just
how much a higher refresh rate affects
user experience battery life on this
phone is excellent I've gotten anywhere
from 7 to over 8 hours of screen on time
with heavy use and on a super heavy day
of use I hover around 6 to 7 hours so
either way the battery has proven to be
very reliable for power user type usage
in addition to that charging is quick
and convenient it's convenient with
wireless charging and quick with the
included 25 watt adapter and cable and
on top of that there's support for
charging with a 45 watt adapter good
stuff
overall speed and performance is great
as well there's really nothing worth
speaking on other than it's fast and
powerful everything has worked as it
should even that in display fingerprint
scanner has worked just fine for me
anyway I say that because it doesn't
look like
everyone has had the same luck I know
it's not ideal it's not super accurate
it doesn't work every single time but it
gets the job done and I personally
haven't really had any issues with it
face unlock is super quick albeit less
secure but it totally wins the
convenience category the cameras are
great too we're looking at pretty much
the same lens trio we got with the s10
plus so you can expect a lot of the same
results which isn't a bad thing to be
honest you can get some really great
looking shots thanks to the versatility
we get with these cameras and the
software there are a couple of new
things that Samsung implemented like
zoom in mic a our doodle there's live
focus video just to add on to the
already extensive library of camera
features but overall as a
point-and-shoot camera for pictures and
videos it's great not perfect and
definitely not perfect not the best but
great now about the s-pen this of course
is what makes the note the note it's the
main thing that sets this phone apart
from every other phone out there on the
market the s-pen got its usual yearly
improvements like better hardware and
better handwriting recognition and it
also got a new set of features mostly in
the camera app where you can now perform
gestures to switch between camera modes
you can zoom in and out basically
control everything remotely which is
pretty cool and it still does all the
other things we know and love the s-pen
for but there's still nothing really
groundbreaking going on here now I've
said this about the s-pen a few times
before it's something that I love having
but it's not something I necessarily
miss when I'm using a different phone
for a while I started to wonder if I was
in love with the s-pen or more so the
novelty of having the s-pen I think now
it might be a little bit of both I think
it's a phenomenal tool and companion to
the note and there are actually quite a
few genuine use cases for it but over
time I found that I use the s-pen to try
to get myself to use it more often than
me actually having a use for it now
that's not a slight on it at all I do in
fact have actual uses for it it just
means that I'm not within the target
audience as much as I used to be I still
love it though speaking of target
audiences it looks like the note 10 plus
is geared towards creators now as much
as it is towards pure power users with a
new s-pen and camera features the video
stabilization improvements
the baked-in video editor the updated
samsung decks functionality you can now
plug it into your existing computer you
don't need a dedicated screen and
peripherals anymore there's also
Microsoft's link to Windows function and
then of course you've got all the usual
multitasking features shortcuts tweaks
and customizations all that really there
are a good number of features other
phones just don't offer which is why the
Galaxy Note continues to sit in a class
of its own look I love this phone and I
do recommend that those interested pick
one up but only if you have no problem
shelling out $1100 for one my advice
would be to wait a bit for the price to
go down see if you can trade in a
current device to slash the price in
half or if you're finding that you don't
absolutely need everything that the note
has to offer main leave the s-pen but
you still want a large powerful Android
phone save the money and check out the
oneplus 7 pro or Samsung's own s 10 plus
the Note legacy lives on there's nothing
crazy or jaw-dropping going on here
noting that note 9 users need to drop
their phones for and that's okay the
note 10 plus continues to refine the
feature-packed spec monster that it is
the large phone that so many have come
to love we may not have gotten anything
groundbreaking or super innovative but
this ended up being a pretty great way
to close out the year so what do you
guys think of the Galaxy Note 10 to hear
your feedback anyway that does it for
